page.title: 03NANTGLYN VILLAGE.
page.content: The oldest housing is seen at the crossroads.Many cottages are 200 years old, with slate floors, beam ceilings and inglenook fireplaces. One is dated 1769,with the initials WRM, another is the old Smithy. The site of the village is much older and many of the houses include the name llan(enclosure by a church). Penllan was once a pub. called the Victoria Inn, and Tyn y Llan was once a shop.There were 3 public houses serving the drovers on their way to Denbigh. Two of the old houses in the village are "second homes". Two others are on sale having been bought by outsiders. The attitude of some local people is against such purchases. They feel it raises the price too high for local buyers, and that it threatens the Welsh Lifestyle.
